sen.e: According to "Somin shorai" (Japanese old story and the folk religion originated in the story) in "Bingo no kuni Fudoki" (unknown or lost writing) quoted in "Shaku Nihongi" (annotated text of the Nihon Shoki) (Kanekata URABE, the mid Kamakura period), a kaya grass ring was worn on a waist to avoid disasters, and it was believed that the strong vitality of kaya grass had a mysterious power to prevent disasters.
